dtoMap

public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Property>>> dtoMap
A static map of all the property maps indexed by DTO name; used to cache the property maps for name disambiguation as a performance improvement. The map is public for sharing with various PSM classes that use it.

Constructor Detail

StringUtilities

public StringUtilities()
Method Detail

buildVariableName

public static java.lang.String buildVariableName(java.lang.String name,
                                                 java.lang.String prefix,
                                                 java.lang.String suffix)

Build a variable name from a name and a prefix. The prefix is optional. If you have a name and no prefix, the variable name is the name with the first character in lower case. If you have a prefix and a name, the variable name is the prefix with the first character in lower case concatenated to the name with the first character in upper case. If you have a suffix, the variable name is the prefixed variable name concatenated to the suffix with its first character in upper case. If you supply a blank or null main name, the method returns just the indicated prefix with the first letter in lower case.

If the name has an underscore in it, use the same convention and append the prefix and suffix with an underscore separator.

Parameters:
name - the base name for the variable (optional)
prefix - the prefix to which to append the base name (optional)
suffix - the suffix to append to the prefixed base name (optional)
Returns:
a variable name with appropriate case

xxxgetUniquePropertyPrefix

public static java.lang.String xxxgetUniquePropertyPrefix(org.eclipse.uml2.Property end)

Get a unique property prefix for a property that represents one side of a many-to-many association, usually a recursive one, that has a duplicate name considering only the source class's key names. Produce a unique prefix with (1) the Persistent name from the end OR, if that tagged value is not present for the end, (2) the end name. The designer can thus choose a disambiguating name different from the end name by putting a name tag on the Persistent stereotype on the end.

Note that in the metafacade system for UML2, there is an interface called AssociationEnd that extends Property; to get a prefix for an AssociationEnd, cast it to the type org.eclipse.uml2.Property.

Parameters:
end - the association end for the many-to-many association
Returns:
a unique name for the property based on the key name and a prefix

mapAllProperties

public static void mapAllProperties(java.lang.String ownerName,
                                    Dto owner)
Map all the data members and inherited properties in the shared map of properties keyed on name. The getUniqueName() and getSqlColumnName() methods use this map to generate unique names on demand. The method indexes both the property name and the explicit name (tagged value name) for all properties, since SQL column names may be explicit.

Parameters:
ownerName - the name of the DTO that owns the properties
owner - the DTO that owns the property
See Also:
getUniqueName(PropertyImpl, boolean)

addNameToMap

private static void addNameToMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Property>> propertyNames,
                                 Property p,
                                 java.lang.String name)
Given a map of property lists keyed on name, add a property to the map keying on the specified name either by adding to an existing list for the name or by creating a new list if the name isn't already in the map keys.

Parameters:
propertyNames - a map of property lists keyed on name
p - a property
name - a name on which to key the property

getUniqueName

public static java.lang.String getUniqueName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property)
Get the unique name for a property. This method uses a standard set of name resolution rules to get a unique name after transforming the UML2 property input into a PSM property. If you already have a PSM Property, call the alternative version of getUniqueName.

Parameters:
property - a UML2 Property; cast AssociationEnd to org.eclipse.uml2.Property if you have an object of that type
Returns:
a unique name for the property
See Also:
getUniqueName(PropertyImpl, boolean)

getUniqueQueryName

public static java.lang.String getUniqueQueryName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property)

Get the unique name for a property to use as a query name. Query names need to prioritize the association end name over the explicit object name in the tagged values. This results in classes named with the plural version of the name instead of the singular, object-related name.

This method uses a standard set of name resolution rules to get a unique name after transforming the UML2 property input into a PSM property. If you already have a PSM Property, call the alternative version of getUniqueName. The method uses the same getUniqueName method as the alternative version, but it tells the method to use query name resolution.

Parameters:
property - a UML2 Property; cast AssociationEnd to org.eclipse.uml2.Property if you have an object of that type
Returns:
a unique name for the property
See Also:
getUniqueName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property), getUniqueName(PropertyImpl, boolean)

getUniqueName

public static java.lang.String getUniqueName(PropertyImpl property,
                                             boolean isQuery)
Get the unique name for a PSM property. This method uses a standard set of name resolution rules to get a unique name, accessing the appropriate methods in the Property PSM object. Call this method directly if you already have a PSM Property; if you have a UML2 Property, call the alternative version of getUniqueName.

Parameters:
property - a UML2 property
isQuery - whether the name is a query name
Returns:
a unique name for the property
See Also:
getUniqueName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property)

generateString

public static java.lang.String generateString(int maxlength)
Generate a random string of a maximum length. For strings of length 1, generate a random lowercase letter a-z.

Parameters:
maxlength - the maximum length of the string to generate
Returns:
the random string

useInterfacePrefix

public static java.lang.String useInterfacePrefix(org.eclipse.uml2.Type type,
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.Object p)
Prefix a type name within a fully qualified name with an interface prefix if the useInterfaceForAssociation property is configured to be true. You pass in the configured property from the calling metafacde; you use the metafacade method getConfiguredProperty with the appropriate property name to get the property object. The property must be registered under the metafacade in metafacades.xml.

Parameters:
type - the UML data type
name - the fully qualified name using package separators
p - the metafacade configured property useInterfaceForAssociation
Returns:
the fully qualified name with the type replaced with an interface-prefixed type if the property is true

getQualifiedExtendedTypeName

public static java.lang.String getQualifiedExtendedTypeName(org.eclipse.uml2.Type type,
                                                            java.lang.Object sepProperty,
                                                            org.andromda.metafacades.uml.TypeMappings languageMappings,
                                                            java.lang.Object interfaceProperty)
Get the fully qualified type name based on a specified data type. If the data type is persistent and is not a primitive type and the useInterfaceForAssocation flag is set on, return the interface name rather than just the type name (the type name prefixed with an "I"). The calling metafacade must supply the namespace separator property ( getConfiguredProperty(UMLMetafacadeProperties.NAMESPACE_SEPARATOR) ), the language mappings object ( getLanguageMappings()<\code>), and the useInterfaceForAssociation property (getConfiguredProperty("useInterfaceForAssociation")),

Parameters:
type - the UML type
sepProperty - metafacade-supplied NAMESPACE_SEPARATOR property
languageMappings - metafacade-supplied language mappings object
interfaceProperty - metafacade-supplied useInterfaceForAssociation property
Returns:
the fully qualified language-specific type

getQualifiedType

public static java.lang.String getQualifiedType(org.eclipse.uml2.Type type)
Get the fully qualified type name from a type, excluding any Model name from MagicDraw and returning the rest. This will usually be either a name like datatype::String (from the AndroMDA datatype namespace) or java.lang. or java.math. from the java namespace.

Parameters:
type - the UML type
Returns:
the fully qualified type name

getBsTypeName

public static java.lang.String getBsTypeName(org.eclipse.uml2.Type type,
                                             java.lang.String packageName)
Get a standard business-layer type name from the UML type. The UML type should be an object type from the system, not a primitive type. It can be either a persistent type or a transient type. If the type is transient, the output type is the same as the input type.

Parameters:
type - the object type from which to build the business-layer type
packageName - the name of the business-layer subsystem package that contains the business-layer DTO
Returns:
a business-layer DTO type

getExplicitPropertyName

public static java.lang.String getExplicitPropertyName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property)
Get an explicit property name for a UML property. This is the first value in a list of strings in the "name" tagged value on the «Persistent» stereotype.

Parameters:
property - the UML property for which to extract the name
Returns:
the explicit name, or null if there is none

Parameters:
property - the UML2 property with the optional tagged value
index - the index into the array of names
Returns:
the indexed name or null if there is none at the index

                                                             org.eclipse.uml2.Class classObject)
Get the optional explicit name for a generalization foreign key (the foreign key for the generated association from a subclass to a superclass), which comes from the "generated_name" tagged value on the «Identity», «Sequence», or «Guid» stereotypes in the superclass.

Parameters:
stereotype - the specific stereotype to look up

getExplicitPropertyNames

Parameters:

Returns:

getExplicitObjectName

public static java.lang.String getExplicitObjectName(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property)
Get any explicit object name from the "objectName" tagged value associated with the «Persistent» stereotype on the property. If the property is an association end on the associated-class side of an association to an association class, this name represents the name of the PSM object class that represents the object in the PSM association class; it allows specifying a singular name for that object and a plural association end name for the collection of objects in associated classes; it also appears as the foreign key constraint name for the constraint that corresponds to the property.

Parameters:
property - the property for which to get the object name
Returns:
the object name

getBooleanRepresentation

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getBooleanRepresentation(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property)
Get any explicit boolean string representation array from the "representation" tagged value associated with the «BooleanString» stereotype on the property.

Parameters:
property - the UML2 association-end property
Returns:
a list of String values from the "name" tagged value on the «Persistent» stereotype on the property

getBooleanFromString

public static java.lang.Boolean getBooleanFromString(org.eclipse.uml2.Property property,
                                                     java.lang.String value)
Convert a String value into a Boolean representation based on the String representation in a UML2 property (a property with a boolean data type and the «BooleanString» stereotype). The string must not be null or empty.

Parameters:
property - the UML23 property with the representation to use
value - the value to convert
Returns:
the proper Boolean value based on the string input
